alert.note: Alert for Macon; Moultrie; Piatt; Shelby (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 02 at 11:58AM CDT until August 02 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lincoln has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Macon County in central Illinois... Northwestern Moultrie County in central Illinois... Southwestern Piatt County in central Illinois... North Central Shelby County in central Illinois... * Until 100 PM CDT. * At 1157 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Decatur, Mount Zion, Bethany, Long Creek, Lovington, Dalton City, Hervey City, Lake City and Decatur Airport. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
